Description: A thick, curved sherd of cream-grey pottery with an incised triangular motif on the exterior surface. The mark was made post-production. The fabric exhibits many pores in the section and contains inclusions of limestone, and possibly shell. The fragment may have come from a basket-handled amphora.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 27
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 27 has been scratched into interior surface.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxxiii, 6)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.96, p.115, p.129, p.225, pl.67)
